alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 2:44PM CDT until August 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The Flood Watch is now in effect for * Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following areas, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw. In southeast Mississippi, Perry and Wayne. * Through Thursday evening. * Additional rounds of locally heavy rain are expected across the region through Thursday. A very moist airmass is in place and with slow storm motions expected and storms likely training over the same area another 3 to 5 inches of rain will be possible. With the already saturated soils this could quickly lead to runoff and flash flooding of low lying and poorly draining areas. * Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
